keyEvents.title: Hogback and Absalom Escape with Moria
keyEvents.description: Following Moria's defeat, his subordinates flee Thriller Bark with his unconscious body.

keyEvents.title: Straw Hats Celebrate Victory
keyEvents.description: The Straw Hat crew celebrates their victory over Moria with a feast on Thriller Bark.

keyEvents.title: Luffy Tells Brook About Laboon
keyEvents.description: On Thriller Bark, Luffy reveals to Brook that Laboon is still alive and waiting.

description: A massive ship designed to look like an island, serving as the base for Gecko Moria and his zombie army. The Straw Hats have just defeated Moria and are celebrating their victory.
significance: The setting for the final events of the Thriller Bark arc, where the crew celebrates victory and Brook learns about Laboon.

keyEvents.title: Rumbar Pirates Meet Baby Laboon
keyEvents.description: Flashback shows the Rumbar Pirates sailing in the West Blue 50 years ago when they first encountered baby Laboon.

keyEvents.title: Rumbar Pirates Play Music for Laboon
keyEvents.description: In the West Blue, the Rumbar Pirates play music to cheer up the sad baby whale.

description: One of the four Blues, the West Blue is where the Rumbar Pirates originated and where they first met baby Laboon 50 years before the current story.
significance: The origin point of Brook and Laboon's relationship. The flashback scenes showing their first meeting take place here.

keyEvents.title: Twin Capes Mentioned as Laboon's Location
keyEvents.description: Luffy tells Brook that Laboon is waiting at Twin Capes, the entrance to the Grand Line where the Straw Hats first met the whale.

description: The entrance to the Grand Line where Reverse Mountain's waters flow. This is where Laboon waits for the Rumbar Pirates to return, having been waiting for 50 years.
significance: The location where Laboon continues to wait for Brook and the Rumbar Pirates. Mentioned as the place where Brook's promise can be fulfilled.
